paragraph.body: It was raining pretty hard out there. I was looking around for her, I think. I was drenched.
I went back inside, ordered another coffee. She still didn't show up. Actually, I never saw her again.

I miss her. Even today I miss her. Without her, sometimes I feel like my apartment is my cell. Like when I'm driving to work, I'm on a treadmill. I just keep doing the same thing, every day, going nowhere but still taking the steps. Sometimes I feel ok. But sometimes, especially when it's late at night, and I'm just lying there, listening to that rain hitting the window--she's there again.
